episodes.title: #19 - People of the State of California vs Daniel Masterson: Scientology Enablers
episodes.description: Welcome back to the Lighthouse Project, a Children of Scientology Production.   Our last episode captured the moments immediately following the conviction of Danny Masterson, in which Christi, Victoria, and Mirriam began to process, digest, and discuss what this might mean for the Jane Does in this trial, as well as all Scientology victims of sexual assault.  For so many of us who were told that real justice would never be possible. We registered the verdict in ripples and emotional shock waves, marveling at how truly momentous and historical this outcome is.  In this episode, Christi and Mirriam are joined by Serge Del Mar, who has been a long-time advocate within our second-generation community.   Serge was born and raised in Scientology, and after surviving the unthinkable hell that is being a minor trapped there, is now a force to be reckoned with on his YouTube channel, https://www.youtube.com/@SergeDelMar which he created to combat the complicity of government, corporate media, and law enforcement.   Serge is recognized for delivering searingly informative dialogue, as he continues to shine a glaring spotlight on violations of human rights, including abuse and sexualization of children, labor trafficking, and much more, that occurs within Scientology organizations.   Together, we discuss the people who have enabled Danny Masterson and Scientology, as they committed horrific acts and were systematically relieved of any consequences for their crimes. Office of Special Affairs  https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Office_of_Special_Affairs  The Office of Special Affairs (OSA), formerly the Guardian's Office, is a department of the Church of Scientology International. According to the Church, the OSA is responsible for directing legal affairs, public relations, pursuing investigations, publicizing the Church's "social betterment works," and "oversee[ing its] social reform programs".  OSA is the successor to the now-defunct Guardian's Office,[6] which was responsible for Operation Snow White and Operation Freakout; both are in Department 20 in the Scientology organizational chart. The most recent head of OSA International was Mike Rinder, who has since departed from the organization and criticizes it severely, appearing as a co-host on Leah Remini: Scientology and the Aftermath.[7]  In addition to regular staff, some church members also act as volunteer collaborators for the office, which cuts down on private investigation and legal research expenses.[9][10] Some volunteers participate under the notion that they receive special "ethics protection".[11] In one case a volunteer who read critical information about Scientology on the internet was led to believe that he would be unable to continue receiving services unless he performed a series of investigations for OSA.[12]   Leaked OSA Volunteer List:  https://scientologymoneyproject.com/2023/08/30/2006-osa-western-us-volunteer-list/   ---   Send in a voice message: https://podcasters.spotify.com/pod/show/children-of-scientology/message Support this podcast: https://podcasters.spotify.com/pod/show/children-of-scientology/support

episodes.title: #18 - People of the State of California vs Daniel Masterson: The Verdict
episodes.description: Welcome back to the Lighthouse Project, a Children of Scientology Production.  In our last episode, Christi and Mirriam broke down the ways in which Scientology really is a perfect hunting ground for predators, and described the environment that exists where there are no conventional protections in place for children.  We discussed the ways that Scientology continues to shift and evolve to evade actions against them in the court system, how they prevent justice for victims and what those of us who were raised in it are doing to change this. In this episode, Christi, Victoria and Mirriam react in live time, to the news of the guilty verdicts in the Danny Masterson trial, immediately following his conviction on two counts of forcible rape.  As we celebrate this outcome together, we ponder upon what this really means... for the Jane Does, for us, and for other Scientology victims. Our conversation meanders across memories, as we recount personal experiences along the way.  Christi closes with a heartfelt letter that she wrote for the Jane Does, which encapsulates our collective thoughts and feelings. episodes.title: #15 - People of the State of California vs Daniel Masterson: LAPD Criminologist Testimony
episodes.description: Welcome back to the Lighthouse Project, a Children of Scientology Production.  In our last episode with Danielle Ballou, we finished reading from the testimony of Jane Doe 2. This provided us with greater insight and understanding regarding some of her experiences within Scientology and the ways in which this affected and impacted her.  We acknowledge Jane Doe 2 for her strength and bravery in her pursuit of justice. And we reflect on our own experiences of growing up in Scientology. In this episode, Danielle Ballou joins us once again. This time, we take a look at the testimony of Jennifer Ferencz, a criminologist at LAPD in forensic science, toxicology.  Danny Masterson overpowered his victims by causing them to ingest an unknown substance, which would incapacitate them. So that the jury may hear facts about drugs used to facilitate sexual assault and understand more about their symptomology, the prosecution called Jennifer Ferencz, who has fifteen years of experience in toxicology. We dive into some of the history of the more well-known drugs used to facilitate sexual assault as well as other substances, including prescription medication.  We discuss symptomology and why it is so important to understand the wide range of potential effects of these substances. We also stress that a good indicator that a person's drink was spiked, is whether the symptoms presented are consistent with what the person knew to have consumed.  We discuss some prevention and protection tactics and ways that a victim can be better supported in the event that this occurs. episodes.title: #14 - People of the State of California vs Daniel Masterson: Jane Doe 2 - Part 3
episodes.description: Welcome back to the Lighthouse Project, a Children of Scientology Production.   In our last episode, we were joined by Danielle Ballou who grew up in Scientology, as we continued with the testimony of Jane Doe 2. We noticed that Jane Doe 2 described Danny Masterson as being very commanding, that he was giving directives, not accepting her refusals, and repeating his commands. It seemed quite familiar to us, so we dove into the Upper Indoctrination TRS: training drills that teach a person to be able to control someone else's body, to make a person obey their commands, despite resistance; the same training that Danny Masterson had completed.   We also talked about the fear tactics and dangerous methods by which Scientology steers people away from getting real, beneficial, and necessary help. Christi and Victoria shared their positive experiences and observations on mental health treatments.  This episode is the second half of our chat with Danielle Ballou, in which we finish reading from the testimony of Jane Doe 2. We understand more about how Jane Doe 2 is impacted by the Scientology handling of the earlier rape that she experienced, and how this affected her, including causing her to not report to law enforcement immediately following the rape by Danny Masterson.   In her testimony, Jane Doe 2 defines OL (Opinion Leader) and says that it is a person of high status, who is valuable to Scientology. She states that if you are an OL, you have value to the church and they protect you. We discuss that in reporting on fellow Scientologists, some people are protected and others aren't, and that by writing a report you could become a target for investigation.   We find ourselves reflecting back on some of our experiences growing up in Scientology. We relate to the difficulties of social connection and intimacy after leaving Scientology. We discuss the decimation of friendships, disappearing kids and never being allowed to say goodbye, the purposeful isolation and punishments which were designed to make us stay in the Sea Org, and the painful reality of parental betrayal in the cover-up of crimes. episodes.title: #13 - People of the State of California vs Daniel Masterson: Jane Doe 2 - Part 2
episodes.description: Welcome back to the Lighthouse Project, a Children of Scientology Production.  In our last episode, we began to take a look at Jane Doe 2's testimony. We learned the circumstances of how she was brought into Scientology and about a prior rape she experienced by another Scientologist; a devastating and traumatic event, after which she was told by the Chaplain that it was not rape: "We're not going to call it that."  The Chaplain showed her policies, which stated that a Scientologist cannot accuse another member in good standing of crimes, that you cannot externally go to law enforcement to report such crimes, and you cannot take legal action or else there would be personal consequences.  This shaped and affected how Jane Doe 2 dealt with the later rape by Danny Masterson.  In this episode, we are so pleased to be joined by Danielle (Dani) Ballou, who grew up in Scientology and is a treasured member of our second-generation community. We reflect on how powerful it feels to unite and compare notes after each being so isolated for so long, and how Scientology has tried so hard to prevent this from occurring.  Together, we pick up where we left off, as we continue with the testimony of Jane Doe 2, to better understand what she went through and what she was up against in her search for justice.  We notice that Jane Doe 2 described Danny as being very commanding, that he was giving directives, repeating his commands, and not accepting her refusals. It seemed quite familiar... we dive into the upper indoctrination TRS, which are the higher level drills that train the student to deliver commands to get a person to obey them and to practice and hone the skill of controlling another person's body.  This training is part of the TR's & Objectives course, which according to the internet, Danny Masterson has successfully completed.  We relate our own experiences with these training drills as children and recall the discomfort we experienced when we were made to do them with adults.  We discuss issues we shared trying to assimilate into the outside world when we left, and how it was often easier to return to the abuse we were familiar with, in Scientology, and the Sea Organization. Dani reflects on wishing she had left for good sooner, and how the final departure was due to the abuse her children were suffering. Christi shares regretting not taking her mother with her when she left.  Christi and Victoria relate their positive experiences with the mental health field, that while imperfect, how much it has helped them and their families recover after Scientology.  We wholeheartedly agree that the internet, ex-Scientology websites, and community resources helped us immensely on our journey out, and evolution to healing after being prevented from accessing this information while in. episodes.title: #12 - People of the State of California vs Daniel Masterson: Jane Doe 2 - Part 1
episodes.description: Welcome back to the Lighthouse Project, a Children of Scientology Production.   In our last episodes, we spoke with Claire Headley regarding the powerful expert witness testimony she provided in this trial. We discussed the systems of Scientology, including language, policies and practices used to control members which prevent them from reporting crimes to law enforcement.  In this episode, we begin to look at Jane Doe 2's testimony to better understand her experience, what she went through, and what she was up against in her search for justice. We learn about how she came to be in Scientology, as a means to address her anxiety. We examine the competing force of Scientology against Psychology and how this prevents people from getting real help for mental illness.  We read the testimony that Jane Doe 2 gave about a prior rape she experienced by another Scientologist and what followed; the reframing and threat of consequences. We discuss some of what expert witness Dr Ziv testified to in this trial, regarding the way victims commonly react to sex assault, and add to that, the efforts of Scientology to suppress the rape Jane Doe 2 knew she'd experienced.  We relate to Scientology's handling of our own experiences with mental health issues, creating intentional stigma around mental health care, psychology, psychiatry, and anything other than Scientology treatment.  We discuss Scientology's anti-psychiatry front group: CCHR - Citizens Commission on Human Rights, Mirriam relates to taring the roof of its Hollywood CA museum, as Sea Org children, when assigned to hard manual labor for wanting to leave the Sea Org, a very lengthy and laborious process.  Victoria grapples with confusion & hurt around her brother's treatment of her, loyalty to Scientology over her, and her field auditor, whom she thought of as a mother, not providing her real help when she was self-harming suicidal after being drug raped, instead providing her Scientology only.  We agree our Scientology abusers and witnesses of our abuses, are also victims of Scientology, and so we must navigate compassion & empathy since most never apologize, or seek forgiveness.   We compare thoughts on Scientologists behaving as though they have a virus or addiction that overwhelms their sense of self, autonomy, ability to see right from wrong and act in their own accord, while they're led to believe, and behave as if they are doing the opposite: being free thinking, self-determined, and helping.   We conclude a real danger of Scientology is its ability to use well-meaning members to perpetrate harm, and fraud on others. episodes.title: #11 - People of the State of California vs Daniel Masterson: Scientology Expert Witness - Claire Headley - Interview Part 2
episodes.description: Welcome back to the Lighthouse Project, a Children of Scientology Production.   In our last episode, we began our discussion with expert witness, Claire Headley, in relation to the testimony that she gave when she was called to the stand by the prosecution in the Danny Masterson trial, to answer questions about the policies and practices of Scientology.   We examined some of the aspects of Scientology, which by design trap and systematically continue to confine a person, keeping any potential resources out of reach and further preventing them from getting help.   In this second part of our chat with Claire, we focus on the system of Scientology, including channels of communication and reporting, types of reports, and the collection and management of information on a mass scale.   We define three separate computerized systems, the type of information they contain, who they are accessible to, and how that information is used, including against members on public internet hate sites created to discredit members who leave and speak out about the abuses they experienced and witnessed.   Meanwhile, when records requests are made by authorities/courts, Scientology denies maintaining extemporaneous records on members, or claim protection by priest-penitent privilege, even from members themselves, and members confessions are the sole property of Scientology.  We acknowledge the impacts that Claire Headley has had through providing the facts on Scientology's policies and practices in this trial and beyond that, her efforts which have helped to expose the abuses of Scientology. If you enjoy this podcast and our content, please like/follow/share, or support our efforts by following Children of Scientology on social media, or here:⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠ ⁠⁠https://podcasters.spotify.com/pod/show/children-of-scientology/support⁠⁠⁠⁠  Jump into the convo - send us a voice message - we may use it in an upcoming show: ⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠https://anchor.fm/children-of-scientology/message ⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠  LINKS: Claire Headley Expert Testimony Trial Notes: ⁠https://tonyortega.substack.com/p/claire-headley-testifies-danny-masterson⁠ Scientology information gathering sites: Religious Technology Center Information Gathering System: https://www.rtc.org/reports/form/index.html?locale=enhttps://www.rtc.org/index.html https://drive.google.com/file/d/123vqqt4sUeBfVeCLscgpy5NALsL3Zb7n/view  International Network of Computer Organized Management INCOMM: Tom Rummelhart, a Scientologist and computer operator responsible for some of the maintenance of the Church of Scientology's INCOMM computer system leaks documents onto the web.  https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Penet_remailerhttps://www.spaink.net/cos/rnewman/anon/penet.htmlhttp://www.xenu-directory.net/mirrors/www.whyaretheydead.net/krasel/INCOMM.html#-AB- Blown for Good:  Behind The Iron Curtain of Scientology⁠- ⁠Headley worked at Scientology’s secret desert compound, which houses all Scientology management, for 15 years. The 500-acre property is located deep in the California desert. The local townspeople were told lectures and films were made there. But is that all that was happening? It is the location of a multi-million dollar home for L. Ron Hubbard, built two decades after his death. It is the home of Scientology’s current leader, David Miscavige. So what really happens at the Int Base? Could stories of armed guards, weapons, staff beatings, and razor wire fences be true? If so, how could a facility like this exist in modern-day America? episodes.title: #8 - People of the State of California vs Daniel Masterson: Letter from Jane Doe 1's Mother to David Miscavige
episodes.description: Welcome back to the Lighthouse Project, a Children of Scientology Production.  This episode includes descriptions and graphic details of rape as we read from a leaked internal letter Jane Doe 1's mother wrote to Scientology leader, David Miscavige, as she tries to escalate "handling" Danny Masterson's rape of her daughter, using Scientology's own incredibly detailed notes from interrogations of Danny Masterson, and Luke Watson and their changing stories.  In Scientology speak, she explains her understanding of what happened to her daughter, being forced to accept blame, and being sold very expensive "security checks" (metered interrogations) so that she could take full responsibility for her violent rape, and near-death experience.   She was angered by what she perceived as mishandling of the reported rape, and requested David Miscavige put a stop to the actions taken by Scientology officials, which she described as "squirrelly"; not in line with standard technology, and not a correct use of Scientology practices.  We compare the tv docu-series "Shiny Happy People" to Scientology, reflect on Scientology as a system, confining its members to its own language, and internal procedures, in which you must refer to the policy before offering an opinion, where the individual's voice is reduced and restricted, and how this comes through in this letter. We draw on our experiences of the effects of Scientology's practices on the inhibition of emotion and our lack of awareness of our personal boundaries and rights.   Jane Doe 1's mother hasn't realized yet, this is the way that Scientology treats crimes - victims are blamed & punished, not perpetrators. Her adherence to Scientology keeps her in this closed system rather than involving law enforcement or providing testimony in this trial. Thanks to this letter, we now understand more of Scientology's continued efforts to threaten, silence, and control Jane Doe 1, and how David Miscavige was fully involved and aware. episodes.title: #5 - People of the State of California vs Daniel Masterson - Sexual Assault Expert Dr Ziv - Part 2
episodes.description: Welcome back to the Lighthouse Project, a Children of Scientology Production.   In our last episode, we focused on the expert witness testimony of Dr. Barbara Ziv who is a forensic psychiatrist specializing in sexual assault. She talked about the common myths and misconceptions that relate to sexual assault and rape and the counterintuitive ways that a victim might react. She emphasized that most instances of sexual assault are done by someone known to the victim.  In this, our fifth episode, we continue our examination of Dr. Barbara Ziv testimony, covering such topics as reasons a victim might have continued contact with their abuser, why most victims don't report, the gap between belief and the prosecution of a criminal case, the burden of evidence on the victim to support their case, options for reporting, access to support, types of police statements, memory stress impact on statements, the conviction rate of perpetrators and why most of these types of criminal cases don't progress or produce a successful outcome.  During redirect, Mr. Mueller had asked Dr. Ziv if there were certain date-rape drugs that put you "on the same continuum" (continuing to function, not rendering immobile) and she responded that there were - "whole classes of drugs".  We discuss our own complex incidences of date rape drugging and the confusing effects that we experienced. Victoria, whose drug rape occurred while still in Scientology, shares how it was "handled" by Scientology, so similar to the Jane Does in this trial, where she was also blamed, punished, assigned lower conditions, make amends, and forced to try to "help" her rapists, in order for her to fully take responsibility for "pulling in" what happened to her. She touches on her resulting first suicide attempt, and how Scientology forced her to sign release forms, absolving them, should she succeed. episodes.description: Welcome back to the Lighthouse Project, a Children of Scientology Production.   Our second episode is Part 1 of a freeform conversation around Jane Doe 3 testimony and topics:   Amanda Rae arrives, we introduce ourselves, plus share a little more about why we're each here. We touch on staying "under the radar", some lightbulb moments, and finally letting go of Scientology. We continue our discussion around the Danny Masterson Rape Retrial and relate to Jane Doe 3 testimony.  We dig into Field Auditing and prolonged "security checking" and the blaming of children who experience sexual trauma, what it feels like to be a child at a rural "Org", more on the "Cadet Org" and separation from parents, and how children often reach the conclusion that it hurts less to let their parents go.  We scratch the surface of parallels in our own childhood experiences around the practice of "No HE&R" (no human emotion and reaction), the practice of victim blaming via being made to describe in great detail (and repetitively) how you "pulled in" anything negative that happens to you (even if it means inventing false memories in a past lifetime), more on Scientology euphemisms, and how all of these things strategically and effectively control how children are allowed to feel, process experiences, and are able or unable to communicate about them, plus long term emotional & mental health impacts.   You can chime in via voice message: https://anchor.fm/children-of-scientology/message   If you enjoy this podcast, and our content, please like, follow, and share. episodes.title: #1 - Introducing the Lighthouse Project Podcast, first discussion: People of the State of California vs Daniel Masterson: Opening Statements
episodes.description: Introducing the Lighthouse Project, a Children of Scientology production.   In our inaugural episode, you'll hear from founders, Mirriam, Christi, and Victoria, all raised in, who define it's purpose, and set a solid foundation for future discussions, offering a compelling glimpse into the experiences of individuals raised within Scientology, and initiating important conversations about mental health, justice, and contradictory messages by Scientology, what they do versus what they say they do.  This project is intended to offer an opportunity to discuss the unique experiences of individuals raised in the controversial group. The goals are to create awareness of its impact on children, explore their sense of self, family dynamics, and mental health, find ways to heal, and share tools  By providing a platform for dialogue and healing, we hope this is a valuable resource for any interested in understanding the impact of Scientology on its youngest members. An added value lies in its ability to offer a safe space for legacy individuals to share stories and shed light on a lesser-known aspect of Scientology, the children.  By amplifying these voices, we hope our project gives a broader understanding of the impacts of high-control upbringings, offering support and validation for those who've navigated the complexities of leaving or questioning their involvement in the thing they were formed around. Children of Scientology's mission is to raise awareness, create community, and provide support for those who grew up in it.  We intend for this podcast to offer a valuable and unique opportunity to hear more than the typical space opera, outrageous doctrine, and celebrity stories. Instead, giving insight into the unique challenges and dangers faced by children of the organization.  In our first discussion, we turn our attention to the retrial of Danny Masterson, who was raised in Scientology, and has been charged with three counts of forcible rape by the Los Angeles County District Attorney's Office, many of his victims, and witnesses called to testify were also raised in Scientology.   Throughout the course of this trial, we will address various pieces of the victim's testimonies and expert witness testimonies. We'll discuss parallels in our own experiences with Scientology, and its consistent controlling of a victim's narrative, language, emotions, and denial of rights and access to care (including of children) through its systematic control mechanisms.   We wish to bring attention to the details in this case so that we can more deeply understand what the Jane Doe's went through, what they were up against and to gain a sense of what it took for them to get there. We begin this journey with the opening statements.
